00021 
00022 #include "util/chksum.h"
00023 
00024 using namespace affxutil;
00025 
00026 /*
00027  * Store the one's complement of the checksum in the header of the data.
00028  * To validate the data, compute the one's complement of the data. The
00029  * resulting checksum should be zero.
00030  */
00031 uint16_t CheckSum::OnesComplementCheckSum(void *addr, size_t size)
00032 {
00033         uint16_t *pdata = (uint16_t *)addr;
00034         uint32_t sum = 0;
00035         uint16_t checksum;
00036 
00037         // Compute Internet Checksum for "size" bytes
00038         // beginning at location "addr".
00039         while( size > 1 )
00040         {
00041                 sum += *pdata++;
00042                 size -= 2;
00043         }
00044 
00045         // Add left-over byte, if any
00046         if( size > 0 )
00047                 sum += * (unsigned char *) pdata;
00048 
00049         // Fold 32-bit sum to 16 bits
00050         while (sum>>16)
00051                 sum = (sum & 0xffff) + (sum >> 16);
00052 
00053         // Compute the one's complement of the checksum.
00054         checksum = (uint16_t) ~sum;
00055         return checksum;
00056 }
